eventsfinder.description: Personal project currently under development. Conceived and developing EventsFinder, a platform for automated event search on social media by location with multi-cloud architecture. Implemented Clean Architecture, SOLID, CQRS, and TDD. Personal project I will step away from when I have a new job.
bullets: Backend: .NET 10 with ASP.NET Core, Entity Framework Core, and multiple databases (PostgreSQL with PostGIS for geolocation, SQL Server, and Oracle).
Frontend: React with TypeScript, Vite, and Tailwind CSS, ensuring a modern and responsive experience.
Deployment and infrastructure: Unified deployment on AWS and Azure, using Lambda Functions / Azure Functions, API Gateway, SQS/Service Bus, and serverless applications.
External integrations: Connectors for social networks (Instagram, Facebook, Twitter/X), Google Maps API for geolocation, and integration with OpenAI for intelligent data enrichment.
Bug fix automation: Integrated system for capturing, aggregating, and prioritizing errors with automated fixes via AI, improving resolution time and code quality.
CI/CD: GitHub Actions with incremental builds, selective deployment, and multi-environment (staging/production).
Quality practices: TDD, unit and integration tests, configurable mocks, Result Pattern for safe error handling.
Observability: End-to-end OpenTelemetry, metrics, distributed tracing, health checks, and Application Insights integration.
eventsfinder.technologies: .NET 10, C# 12, ASP.NET Core, Entity Framework Core, PostgreSQL/PostGIS, React, TypeScript, Vite, Tailwind CSS, AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, API Gateway, Amazon SQS, Azure Service Bus, SNS, S3, OpenTelemetry, Application Insights, OpenAI (models and embeddings), GitHub Actions, Docker, Aspire, JWT Authentication, Terraform, Kubernetes.

Developed business days calculation library replacing API queries, reducing latency in massive reports.

MVVM standardization in Windows Forms: implemented MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel) pattern in Windows Forms applications, replacing direct database access with API communication, reducing coupling and improving testability.
SOLID and design patterns application: promoted and applied SOLID principles and design patterns, improving code quality and maintainability, resulting in significant gains in development time.
Database performance: optimized SQL queries in critical systems, reducing execution times in reports with thousands of records from minutes to seconds.
CRM restructuring: transformed legacy web application into single page application with ASP.NET MVC and JavaScript, improving response time and user experience.
Business days calculation function: developed local library with periodic holiday updates, replacing API and database queries; applied in massive reports, reducing latency and infrastructure load.
Integration with multiple databases: architected integration with SQL Server and Couchbase, ensuring efficient data flow between different persistence layers.
Stakeholder collaboration: maintained continuous contact with business areas, reviewed requirements, and adapted solutions to meet specific compliance and operation needs.
ubs.technologies: .NET 8, .NET Framework 4.8, ASP.NET MVC, JavaScript, Windows Forms, MVVM Pattern, SQL Server, Couchbase, Oracle. Practices: monolith to microservices migration, SOLID, design patterns, query optimization, code refactoring. Environment: multinational team, meetings in English, direct contact with stakeholders.

framework.name: Multi-cloud Ready Framework
framework.description: Reusable framework for cloud provider abstraction (AWS and Azure), enabling unified deployment with dynamic configuration. Architecture based on Clean Architecture, SOLID, CQRS, and DDD, with abstractions for message publishing, image upload, message queue consumption, and serverless hosting. Supports Terraform for IaC and Kubernetes for container orchestration, ensuring portability and scalability across different cloud environments.

asyncflow.name: Asynchronous Message Flow
asyncflow.description: Reusable framework for orchestrating complex asynchronous message flows, with tracking and pending message control system. Implements pipeline execution state control, progress tracking, dependency management between steps, and failure recovery. Supports distributed handlers, parallel processing, and integration with multiple messaging systems (SQS, Service Bus), ensuring reliability and scalability in complex workflows.
